title: Excellent service
body: Despite the current challenges that the practice is contending with, the service we received was excellent from the receptionist through to the GP. We were offered a convenient appointment, although all of them are great, on making this appointment the person I spoke to was extremely polite, professional, had a very calm approach and listened to the concerns I had, then made me an appropriate appointment with the GP that I requested to see without any hesitation, much appreciated. The GP that we met with was extremely good, listened to the concerns, conducted a thorough examination, and explained treatment options. Their approach was very reassuring, and presented as really interested and invested in us. I have always had a very satisfying experience within this surgery but when dealing with sensitive issues and having worries about family it was reassuring to have been met with such approachable and receptive professionals. Much appreciated.

title: Delightful practice
body:
I had to visit Manchester on 3 occasions for the initial testing,surgery and finally I thought I had an issue 3 weeks after post surgery but was seen the day after.Tests were carried out and I left the practice with a clean bill of health and almost,in my view,20 20 vision.
The staff were always kind and professional.I couldn't have asked for more.
On each occasion I was initially anxious but left the practice feeling comfortable and confident.
I would recommend Spamedica and all of it's staff to everyone.

A satisfied customer.

title: Very good urology and oncology experience inc…
body:
My prostate cancer treatment 'journey' which started in autumn 2018 was generally very good. Barring one locum oncologist, who seriously lacked 'people' and communications skills (I was relieved to be told when that individual moved on), all the professionals treating me at CGH have been brilliant. I especially praise the urologist, the specialist nurse and the radiography team.

The whole thing would get five stars from me were it not for the chaotic admin process and some unexpectedly long waiting times. However tempting it is to cut clerical staff, often this shows and it lets patients down.

title: Not happy with the care
body: I don't know if anyone from the practice will see this, but I'm leaving a review because I think it might help them improve with this issue. I have been using this surgery for years and although the reception team is really friendly and helpful, I have never been happy with the care provided. I understand that doctors are busy, but I have always felt that they were very brusque and dismissive, didn't give me a chance to explain my symptoms and medical history, or clearly go over the steps I should take. I always left appointments feeling upset and still confused about the best thing to do for my health. The doctors seemed to approach problems by prescribing anything they could and then getting me out the door as soon as possible. I don't feel as though I was treated as an individual and always felt that they would prefer that I wasn't there at all. Again, I'm sure the doctors are just busy and see people with bigger problems than mine, but they always made me feel like an obstacle rather than a patient. If you are going to join this surgery, make sure you can stand up for yourself.

title: fantastic
body:
These reviews baffle me and I don't normal bother with them but in this instance I think the people I came in contact with at the Manor hospital and the ambulance crew who took control of a situation when my wife had a severe nose bleed 18/3 due to a drug reaction were ...great...When I say nose bleed I mean nose bleed she was choking on blood.A clamp was put on her nose to stop the bleeding and after arriving at the hospital we were put into a cubicle. Within a few minutes a nurse came in and started doing tests blood pressure ECG etc then a doctor took over.  I was allowed to stay with my wife because she has dementia and the Doctor got me a cup of coffee and some water for my wife who's mouth was covered with blood.
The doctor eventually removed the clamp, decided the bleeding had stopped and the nurse cleaned my wife's face and the Doctor arranged for an ambulance at nearly midnight to take us home..As I said I do not normal bother with reviews and  this might be the first and the last one I fill in but I think the people who dealt with my situation that evening deserve a big thank you from my wife and myself

author: Tojo
title: Cancelled appointment
body:
my son has a chronic knee condition and had to go off work in September 19. A job he has now lost due to length of time off.  
He has been in constant pain and remains so. He has blood pressure readings regularly of 212/111. Lincoln County have been hopeless. Misdiagnosis without carrying out basic tests.  
He has become more unwell, including stress & depression. He is experiencing other pains and horrendous headaches, visual disturbances, pins and needles in his head with hot flushing feelings. During these attacks his legs feel like they expand and tingle.  
Just now, he has received a text cancelling his appointment with the Orthopaedic Consultant for March 2020. Almost 6 months since his problems began.  
His own GP & physio have advised him to attend A&E to short cut the system, but he never did believing it would be unfair. See where he is today .....

author: Project Lead
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Not enough is being done
body: Abandoned and isolated. Not enough is being done and the wait is on-going even after 2 years, and during that time paperwork has been misplaced twice.

title: Superb Practice
body:
This practice is truly amazing ..... from the Doctors to receptionist a great caring professional TEAM. Changed 5 years ago what a find they have been so helpful when I needed to visit them, can't thank them enough proper Doctors not a conveyor operation.

Thanks to all involved with this amazing practice

title: Thankyou
body: Many thanks for the Text message This morning. Can I just say that you guys at the surgery and all those that work in the NHS are doing a wonderful job and thank you so much. Stay strong and stay healthy ❤️

title: Very good and welcoming practice
body: My last visit was of a high standard doctor was very thorough and took my symptons very seriously, they called colleague for help And they immediately came to assist them

author: Katy R
title: Physiotherapist/rehabilitation visitor.
body: I would like to provide complimentary feedback in respect of Claire who has assisted my Aunt on 2 home visits. My Aunt has severe mobility issues and Claire initially assessed her needs from walking aids to toilet assistance. She was extremely patient and explained her suggestions to my Aunt in layman's language and how her suggestions would ease her around her home. She returned with all the equipment and installed, explained and tested with my Aunt to her total satisfaction, despite my Aunt being a bit apprehensive during the first visit. Not only has my Aunt been assisted but also myself who is her carer and my mind put to rest knowing she has further aids to help her safety. I would hope Claire would be commended for her hard work and dedication.

title: Compassionate People
body: Have needed support from the people working within Amble practice under differcult circumstances and feel they are warm and helpful they have showed me nothing but compassion and friendliness ..THANK YOU

author: wallace11
title: My care was first class
body:
I was admitted today to the Q Day Surgery Unit , to have a Green Light Laser prostatectomy carried out. This was just first class treatment and care from the moment I arrived until I was allowed home. I would like to thank all the staff, from the receptionist, nurses, anaesthetist to the "top man " my surgeon, for the professional  
attention given . Once again , thank you.  
Regards,

title: Best in Warwickshire
body: Myself and my family have used this practice for over 10 years, I have never had such fantastic treatment and care as I have here. Respect, care and compassion have always been upmost in the service we have had.

author: TMOR
title: Exceptional level of Care
body: I presented myself at the walk in centre with a really nasty infected lump on my ear my GP had been giving me antibiotics which had made no difference the doctor and nurse on duty treated my ear and I’ve received continued care for which I’ve been extremely grateful

author: Customer C
title: Staff at Coffee shop
body: I was so impressed with the man serving there while I sat waiting for news on my very poorly grand son. I didn’t get the mans name but his kindness and compassion was amazing in such an uncaring world. He raised my spirit! God bless him!

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

author: gems
title: Covid 19 precautions in OutPatient clinic
body:
This week I had an urgent mammogram at Crosshouse. I have been self isolating for the past week because of a health conscious diction specified in the 'vulnerable' category. I was able to keep 2m away from people from the entrance to the X Ray Dept. The receptionist was very professional and friendly. Thank her for that. I stood away from the two women waiting and was listening to the latest from the First Minister and Scottish politician. A member of staff came to turn up the volume which was fine.However they went on to make a flippant comment which I found inappropriate. We know nothing about what's happening. This did not Instil confidence. As a member of NHS staff myself I was taken aback because we are sent an email Daily Digest and Newsflash. Also there was an open session on at the hospital that day.  
All else was fine. I would have liked reassured that the plastic basket was anti bac between patients.  
Today I went to Outpatient area 2 to see the surgeon. There were at least 20/30 people waiting all sitting in close proximity. The whole area was very quiet and people could have been split up. Chairs could have been removed to create distance. My partner and I waited down the short corridor at 2a area. The surgeon was very professional and clearly experienced. The student nurse was lovely. And they were all very respectful. My partner is a wheelchair user and plenty of space to accommodate that. Thank you.  
Then we went off to X-ray again.  
This time there was a sign in the desk about Covid 19 and symptoms and the same lovely receptionist asked the relevant questions. There was a sign that said 'if you are self isolating....' to inform. I did that and they had NO idea what to do but did go to check, came back and asked us to sit amongst the busy waiting area!  
We were then offered a potentially infected laminated waiting number which we declined. We waited in the corridor.  
The nurse who came to fetch us was lovely. This nurse offered to push my partners wheelchair but since we saw them wipe their nose on their bare arm, we declined.  
Another blue plastic basket to navigate. Had it been cleaned since I was there the other day?  
Consultant and the nurse were informative and supportive and I thank them. The bourse was painless yay!  
Back to Waiting area 2 which was quieter but tried to maintain the requisite 2 metres with difficulty.  
Offered a phone call with results instead of a visit. Good call!  
Thanks where thanks are few. But shocking in the lack of precautions. I've been offered home working and I'm glad I dont have to go back into hospital until after this crisis.  
I hope you understand that I am not an anxious person. I am an NHS Staff member and am thinking maybe I shouldn't have retired so early!!

author: March2020
title: Emergency eye appointment
body:
I had an appointment recently at the Eye OP clinic. It was an emergency appointment and I had been told it would be busy so I had no problem with having to wait.  
My concerns are as follows:  
1) I saw no staff member either wash or gel their hands during the duration of my time there (over 2 hours - most in the waiting area). This also included the staff who attended to me both nurse and doctor. In our current climate where every member of the public visiting the department was asked to gel their hands I felt this was not acceptable.  
2) There were a lot of elderly patients there and they were given little assistance, no water and it was not obvious that there was any water available for anyone to drink  
3) On being taken through to the doctor it was very clear that they were busy as at the start of the consultation the doctor was trying to make a phone call. They didn't have the correct number and went out then someone else came in without knocking to give the number. Another member of staff entered the room, no apology for the interruption, dropped something on the floor and then took it out of the room unwashed, uncleaned (a similar item was used to put a lens on my eye for examination). The doctor doing my assessment did not at any time wash or gel their hands and the doctor was examining my eyes. I didnt feel fully listened to at the start of the consultation - the doctor kept speaking about the wrong eye and I had to correct them. The doctor then got the details of my emergency optician appointment wrong even though I had just informed them when it had been. And then got the day of the start of symptoms wrong again even after I had just told them.  
I understand when a department is busy staff can be distracted but I feel that if they need to make calls, access equipment from other rooms this should be done before a patient is taken through and/or knocking on a door when a consultation is taking place is not acceptable. They also need to pay attention to the details the patient provides them with during the consultation as this is the only time that patient will have with that member of the healthcare team.  
I feel that my management and discussion around the issues I was having were treated very lightly as if it was an inconvenience for me to be there. I did not feel information about the diagnosis was given that well - it was almost as if it didn't matter. Well it does to me!  
There was one nurse who I felt was professional and caring working that afternoon

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: A happy wife
title: Husbands Gastric Illness
body:
My husband was recently admitted to Fvrh for an ongoing gastric condition that flares up every few years. There is no cure at present and sometimes he responds to medication, other times he does not. He was originally admitted to CAU, then up to SAU, then along to B32 (where he met a fab nurse he called Joe, who’s care and bubbly demeanour was fab). He was then moved down to a 3 bedded bay in Day Surgery where he spent 1 night before being moved yet again to a single room round the corner. 5 moves in 5 days, which wasn’t ideal.  
Every new ward he went to, he had to explain his condition all over again to the staff, which he found quite draining. He spent the next full week in his room in Day Surgery and as hospitals go, it was like having private care. The staff in Day Surgery are some of the most wonderful staff you’ll meet. The care, attention and concern they showed towards my husband and myself was second to none. They kept his spirits up with their friendly chat and stories. Nothing was too much of a bother and in fact one nurse took the time to sit down with him and discuss a plan of action with regards to his fluids and vitamin Iv’s. She was instrumental in getting him the hydration and energy therapy he had been on during a previous hospital admission and which we felt he needed at that point.  
There are too many staff members to each name individually but everyone from the fantastic nurses, auxiliaries, domestics and housekeepers (who kept him going with what dinner choices he couldn't manage to eat: ), and kept him topped up with black tea, are all just a credit to the NHS.  
Even after he had a gastric feeding tube inserted by the lovely Louise, the staff kept popping in to ask if he was ok, did he want to try something to eat or drink, did he need anything? Excellent overall care.  
After much discussion with Kay, a lovely dietitian, a plan for discharge was put in place. On the day he left, Arlene went out of her way to help him down to the main entrance with all his bags and waved us off. My husband is doing ok, he’s eating small amounts and hoping to get the tube removed soon and get back to normal. Thank you Day Surgery Staff, yous are all stars

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Top Gran
title: Cancer diagnosis and subsequent operation
body:
Referred to Crosshouse hospital gynaecology department in early 2020 and after a few tests, all carried out with the. utmost care and professionalism, was diagnosed with cancer of the womb lining. After our meeting with Dr Francis we were left in no doubt that I would be well looked after , very approachable, caring and reassuring, as was the whole team  
My stay in the gyny ward and all the staff in the unit was fantastic.  
I wish them all the best with the uncertain times ahead with Coronavirus , they are truly deserving of all our support.

author: Mrs Tedsome
title: Very supported and cared for
body: I had an emergency appointment when I was staying with family in Norwich, as I found a lump in my breast over the weekend. After being advised by NHS 24, also very good. The surgery saw me 1. 5 hours after I phoned to see someone. The receptionist, administrator and GP were all excellent and the GP gave me clear advice as to what I need to do once I get home. I felt very supported and cared for throughout.

title: Not so good practice
body: Attended A&E as was struggling to breath all was well at first didn't have to wait for 4 hour was took straight threw to be seen, then put in a bay then the problems started different staff coming and asking the same questions over and over again, then question why I'm irritable mmmm I've not slept because I'm struggling to breath n I'm sat on the most uncomfy chairs have other conditions... To be push threw after several hours for some blood tests and a xray to be then sat for several more hours while other people come and go and after a whole 13 hours to be told go see your gp we don't deal with chronic illnesses... It would have been nice to know what the chronic illness was no I have to wait another 3 months to actually find out of what condition they are on about

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: No confidentiality
body: Attended this department to see if I needed surgery.. Already have depression and other illnesses very anxious on this visit very nervous was alone as I don't have family to attend with me.. Booked my self in the sister didn't even acknowledge me. Sat and waited to them appeared a nurse with a very loud mouth, didn't even know what tests I needed before I saw surgeon then decided to shout to sister at top of her voice in front of a room full of other patients what I was in for which is rude where my confidentiality in all this then the sister and the nurse discussed me as though I wasn't there depressed a bit more more anxious I'm so happy my confidentiality doesn't matter and me being treated like a human didn't matter to them didn't find the staff very friendly or very professional this was my second visit to the unit and the only positive to it was the surgeon was a very down to earth professional man that saw straight away I was very depressed very anxious and was very person friendly and talked me threw everything and I left happier that I didn't even need the surgery yet. I dread having to come back for a check up with the nursing staff if that's how there going to be on visits discuss me as if I'm not there and make sure all the other patients hear what I'm there for I would like to be treat with dignity and respect other patients have while there, I suffer with depression just means I don't talk very much but I'm very disappointed another department that's quite honestly treat me like an alien. I'm even debating asking my gp to refer me to another NHS hospital so I no longer have to use Sheffield

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Practice.
body:
My with suffers really bad anxyity along with copd & enthasemia today she had a phone consultation with a doctor from this practice. 
He made her feel at ease from start to finish he did not rush at all very understanding.
Can't praise this practice enough there is not one person there I could fault an Amazing team.

title: Positive interactions
body: My experience of doctors at this surgery is incredibly supportive and pragmatic...both face to face and the speed of email responses.

title: Hip replacements
body: In March 2020 I had my 2nd hip replacement at the Spire in Stretton.  My first him is a total success so I was looking forward to operation number two. Everything has gone extremely well and am now recovering at home. I can recommend Spire without any hesitation and my treatment overall was very caring and courteous. The food there is also extremely good.

title: Amazing pharmacist
body: The pharmacist was so helpful in getting me my daughters prescription when I ran out. He emailed me out of hours and sorted it out for me

title: Really good practice
body: Always found the gps, clinical staff and support workers marvellous. They are very professional, know their stuff while at the same time showing a friendly and warm attitude. They now have their own pharmacy which is open every day and so convenient. I am full of praise for them all and very grateful to them for working in a way which will combat this awful virus and keep every other medical function running. I wish them my heartfelt thanks

title: Great Practice
body: I would definitely recommend this GP practice to anyone. The doctors are very caring and listen to what you have to say. The receptionist are very polite, welcoming and very helpful.

title: Terrible practice, appalling organisation
body:
Easily the worst, most inefficient and badly organised practice we have ever experienced.

Our newborn babies checkup appointments and immunisation appointments were all cancelled due to an ‘admin error’ 

Each time we attempted to visit, we were waiting between 45minutes at best, and 2 hours at worst.

The doctor that we saw, prescribed the wrong item for our baby, a cream that made her infection considerably worse, necessitating a second trip to a different doctor, who immediately fixed the first doctor’s mid-diagnosis. The first doctor was utterly disinterested in dealing with our baby.

They continued to screw up every aspect of our healthcare, including cancelling a repeat prescription for epilepsy medication, and not advising us of the ongoing issues with their inability to book appointments.

This surgery is a disgrace. We have, quite literally, not had a single appointment of experience with them that has not been completely undone by their total lack of care and professionalism.

I dread to think how they are dealing with things now, during the public health crisis.

This surgery is atrocious and should be closed, until the staff are trained to even a basic level.

title: Chaotic
body:
I recently spent a week in Oakmere North of the Rehabilitation Clinic. From the first time I was taken into my room which I had to share with a much older lady I hated it! It was not a pleasant room to sit in, it felt like a prison cell but thankfully I got on famously with my “room mate” and we made our time together full of laughter. Meal times were chaotic, the beds were extremely uncomfortable and whenever anyone had a shower in the bathroom the floor was flooded right out to the main doorway! The TV in our room didn’t work. There were a few issues of lack of safety from the staff with my lovely room companion, one being that she was given medication but thankfully she didn’t recognise the tablets to be what she normally took and called a nurse who then quickly threw them in our waste bin. This could have resulted in something extremely serious!
I would NEVER want to return here ever again nor would I wish anyone that I know to do so either.
Things here need to improve greatly!

title: Thank you
body: I wish to thank the consultant,drs,sisters,nurses,porters,cleaners and caterers after my recent stay in hospital at the EMU and Pearson ward.I was particularly impressed by the meals i received despite the commonly but mistakenly held view that hospital food is terrible.i was also impressed by the nursing staff who despite being rushed off their feet were calm,caring,cheerful and professional.I`d like to sent my best wishes to all the staff and patients at the Royal hospital at this worrying time during the coronavirus pandemic and hope you all stay safe and well

author: Great Cooking
title: My excellent care at Pilgrim Hospital
body: I was admitted to Pilgrim early March after referral from Mr Rathore for urgent treatment, after have been diagnosed with Gallbladder Blockage that had caused jaundice, the staff from arrival until my operation and discharge were excellent no praise is high enough for the work they do under a lot of pressure, a big thanks to Mr Terry and his team for their great work in getting me better THANKS TO EVERYONE AT PILGRIM

author: akerr90
title: Great care experience
body:
I want to thank my midwife Rachel who looked after me all the way through my pregnancy on the blue team at the RAH (glenburn foxbar Barrhead Neilston team).  
It was great to be assigned 1 midwife from the start until the end of my pregnancy a much more personal care experience and at the end of my postnatal visits I was so sad to say goodbye. She is the best midwife ever and deserves recognition for sending me for a growth scan and potentially saving my babies life.  
Also I would like to thank the theatre team who were brilliant at putting me at ease and all the staff on ward 31A, no one in the maternity unit at the RAH treats you as just a number. Great care experience x

title: Uncaring, disinterested, defensive
body:
Forget about ever getting a referral. You will be denied without a substantive reason. They get very defensive if you ask for the legal basis for denial of care.

I was told - without any tests whatsoever and no diagnosis - that "nothing" could be done for me. Well how could you know this if you haven't done any tests or provided a diagnosis? 

I have a life threatening medical condition and the GP sarcastically asked me if I thought I was going to die. 

I ended up going elsewhere and received a diagnosis and treatment plan and total resolution of symptoms.

author: CJ07
title: Miscarriage lack of communication
body:
I felt Numb as i said the words to her  
My GP rang me today and asked how was my pregnancy getting on as they had to check my medicine since i have epilepsy - i turned round and i said but im not pregnant no more, i lost my baby  
The doctor said they had not had any notification from the hospital, which wasn't their fault i can see and i'm the doctor felt awful making the phone call to me  
I think the hospital has been very poor here not notifying them as other women could be in the same situation as me

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Kgb
title: Someone who cares
body:
I am pregnant and have been really anxious and concerned regarding the Corona virus. I work full time in an NHS setting. I found myself under a lot of stress through lack of information and support. I felt as though I was being passed from pillar to post and couldn't get the correct advice or support. I called my doctor's surgery (Centenary Surgery) and spoke to the receptionist I think her name is Linda or something similar I was extremely distressed.  
I couldn't stop crying, this lady soothed me and made me feel at ease. She was very calm, caring and compassionate. In a time where I felt that no one cared. Even when I contacted the surgery the next day she remembered me, my situation and gave me up to date advice that I hadn't asked for. I know the world is in the middle of a global pandemic. We need more people like her looking out for us. She is an absolute diamond who may feel often under valued, but I will always remember the kindness she demonstrated at such a hard and uncertain time. I honestly can't thank her enough.

title: Great practice
body: The doctors especially the sisters and all the other staff are so helpful and have always gone above and beyond to us whenever we have needed help

title: Amazing service as it always has been and will be
body:
Today I had a telephone consultation amidst the beginnings of COVID-19 inaundating our NHS services. The doctor was so thorough and in high spirits despite probably having to deliver a service with even more minimal resources than usual . It brought a smile to my face how positive and cheerful the doctor was even in this time of adversity.

I want to thank the doctor for taking the time to speak with me and it is incredible that the staff have continued to have such a great attitude even when times are tough.

Thank you again and I hope the entire team at the practice know how much we as a community value and appreciate you.

title: Thank you.
body:
Corona virus
Whilst we all are experiencing very difficult times a big thumbs up and thank you to all the staff here i.e. medical and non medical for your dedication. In particularly the village pharmacy staff for their diligence, care and support  and whilst they are under extreme pressure, they continue to get all medications out to their patients. Thank you also to the drivers who are tasked with making the deliveries. Where would we be without your help? Many thanks.

title: Immediate care, professional service
body: brought in after suffering a heart attack and was immediately examined and put under observation, where I had a second heart attack and was cared for.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: End of life care
body: The ICU team were amazing when my Dad lost his life due to serious illness. The team were totally devoted to him and to me as his daughter. The department is truly filled with love and genuine empathy. I wouldn’t want anyone to go through what we did but the kindness shown for the 36 hours I was there, that was truly outstanding.

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic and efficient practice
body:
Always go above and beyond. 
As a family we have been at the surgery for years. The doctors take their time to listen and come up solutions.

title: Amazing staff
body: I just want to say I’ve only just joined this practice so my experience is limited and only seen nurses and receptionists but the nurses are so fabulous caring knowledgeable and patient and the receptionists have been very helpful on minor issues I am very happy so far

title: Highest praise for the staff and organisation.
body: Spamedica Chelmsford.  Just had my first cataracy surgery at this facility and I have the highest praise for the team and organisation. Very professional, kind and organised staff, who ensured I knew what was going to happen and what I should do. The operation was quick, no discomfort and much better than I expected. Will definately be going back there for my second cataract operation.

title: Amazing care in challenging times
body: I had an operation for a brain tumour and when this was starting to grow again a gamma knife treatment. Therefore, I'm still under observation. I had my MRI on February 11th and an appointment with the consultant or one of their team on the 24th of March. Because of the coronavirus crisis I phoned and asked if I could get the result by phone or email instead of having to attend the clinic of the consultant. On the same day they phoned back, shared the results in a very caring and thorough way over the phone, cancelled my appointment and booked a checkup in two years' time.  I was very impressed by the efficient and quick reply and I am extremely thankful I do not have to travel to Haywards Heath with the very real risk of infection. It's a great thing if someone has the ability to think outside the box in times that are as challenging as they are at the moment.

title: Very Efficient practice
body:
The DR's are very understanding, knowledgeable and sympathetic to my long term illness.
I am very impressed at how quickly my medications & repeat prescriptions are dispensed & available for collection, often well within the stated time.

title: Need a hospital go to BMI
body: All staff are really friendly, polite and treated me with respect. If I needed a private hospital again I would go straight to them, excellent. I would recommend them to anyone.

title: left physically shaking and feeling very…
body: My first visit was for a routine mammogram and the experience was way better than I had hoped for. The nurse was lovely and very reassuring. I came away thinking I was silly for worrying and would feel ok about going for another one in the future.  However I was called back for further testing and my second visit left me feeling shaky and numb. I see others on here have mentioned the warm welcome at reception, I found no such welcome. Soon after I arrived my name was called and I was ushered into a changing room. I asked the nurse if they could tell me why I had been called back as the letter I received was vague, and was told in a very brisk tone, it will be explained to you later. Once the mammogram was done I was called in to see the consultant. Here I was told that they wanted to do more tests, a scan and also a biopsy as they were not totally happy about something the mammogram had picked up. I explained I was nervous about the biopsy. The consultant did not have any of my previous history or test results from years before available during this consultation, even though I had discussed this with the first mammogram nurse several weeks before. Why was this information not available? The consultant did reassure me that they would request this information but did not think it would be of much help. We discussed the findings and then I had the scan. The scan was not conclusive enough and I was informed a biopsy would be needed. It all seemed to happen rather quickly, no time to think. The consultant re-assured me it would not hurt and that I would be fine with the procedure. The nurse was incredible kind and they both talked to me to help calm my nerves. It was at about this point that the whole situation became too much and I just couldn't stop the tears from flowing. The nurse was lovely and offered tissues but the consultant then said 'why are you crying now?' I have say I struggled to know how to respond. I'm lying there half dressed, feeling I must agree to this biopsy, I'm scared stiff, having just mentally peeled myself off the floor because the implication of this procedure is, I might have breast cancer and the consultant wants to know why I'm crying now! Was there a specific point at which I was supposed to cry? The final two nurses I saw were lovely especially the one who took the final mammogram. I know the staff are very busy and they have a lot of appointments to get through and for them it must be just patient after patient, but for the person who has just been told 'there is something on your scan that we are not happy with and needs further investigation' it has just become one of the worst days of their life. Being efficient is one thing but being kind makes all the difference. I left that day to walk back to the car and my teeth were chattering in my head even though I wasn't cold and I was shaking uncontrollably. When I think back on it now, I think I was in shock. I'm in no hurry to return but unfortunately I will have to.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: REQUIRES UPDATING PROCEDURES
body: I was very pleased to learn I was going to North Downs Hospital as I have been previously and treated extremely well.  This time, once again treated extremely well, but would like to say on more than one occasion I was left alone for over 30 minutes, once getting out of wheelchair and twice left on the edge of the bed.  Apologies given from the member of staff, stating it was because they were busy, but there should be a strict rule that patients are not left in these sort of situations for over a certain length of time. I had had surgery and found it very difficult to manouvre and this should not have happened at any time and in fact on one of the occasion where I explained to the nurse coming on duty, she said she had been told and totally unaware I had  been brought back from xray, and again this is very poor.

title: Brilliant practice
body: I have been with this practice all my life never had a problem. Gps are  good . Recptionist are good

title: Excellent hospital
body:
I spent some weeks in Ascot Ward after being referred  by Frimley Park Hospital for physiotherapy to recover from a severe flareup of COPD
The care and kindness of all the nursing staff was exemplorary in all respects, the food was of a good standard, three meals a day plus tea, coffee and soft drinks
One could not really fault the experience  and thank  you for the recovery. NHS IS BRILLIANT as good as private although no fillet steaks!
Peter

title: Outstanding care
body: I visited A&E today concerned about a lump on my leg which had become sore. My GP hadn't looked at it as was only doing telephone appointments but had prescribed antibiotics. The department was operating on half the normal number of nurses and during my 3 hour wait the patient numbers were at times up to 30. I was seen around 8:20pm by a lady doctor who couldn't have been nicer to me, although busy she was friendly and professional, put me at ease and was thorough in inspecting and treating my condition. I was sent away with a couple of dressings and aftercare instructions and my worries about it bursting and causing infection lifted. I only wish I could find a GP like this lady, she is a credit to her profession and the hospital.

title: Fantastic, thank you!!
body:
My little boy was admitted via gp for investigation on paeds obs. Due to the covid19 outbreak we were cared for on fistral. What an amazing, caring and dedicated team. Everyone was so friendly and engaged so beautifully with my son. The stay was completely faultless. I honestly cannot praise highly enough and what makes it even more amazing is the amount of pressure all staff must be feeling due to covid19 and how we still received exceptional care.
Thanks again to you all!

title: So respectful
body:
I went for Breast Screening a short while ago and found from the time the nurse welcomed me  having the screening I found this very professional and dignified.
Thank you  all  you all do a great job and we are so lucky to have you.

Thank you

title: Credit to the Fracture Clinic
body: Credit where credit is due.  My 11 year old attended the Fracture Clinic in January and February and even though the department was choc a block, they saw her promptly and were so kind.  The male nurse was amazing and compassionate.  The Irish nurse was friendly and comforting whilst the Orthopaedic doctors were knowledgeable and patient.  The lovely technician who saw Grace on 16-1-2020, (Yaz) was so lovely to Grace and she even let Grace choose a bright pink, glittery plaster of paris cast.  We had a fabulous experience on this occasion and are very grateful to our NHS.  We are blessed to have it.  Thank you to everyone who works so hard, provides good care and tries there best for the good of the British population.  Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing
body:
The process from start to finish has been the best I could ask for. Everyone has been so understanding which is so helpful as I hate being judged about my decision to abort. 
I was really nervous about my appointment as I didnt know what to expect. But my gosh the nurse was so lovely and really made me feel at ease. I would definitely recommend

title: Wow! Blew me away
body: I had been experiencing pains and was told about the treatment centre and from my first call to check if I should attend I was treated with compassion and care. At a time when the NHS is under such pressure I expected to wait and then get the kind of treatment you get at a GP. No way did that happen! I was triaged quickly and the person who then saw me was brilliant. So reassuring and helpful and I felt a real sense of care and that i could take time to ask questions. Not a service I hope to have to use again but brilliant, thank you. Did have an issue with the car park machine recognising my number plate! Whilst all this virus is happening do think you should waive the car park charges when so many people are losing work and money.

title: Rude and Dismissive Receptionist
body: I have recently moved to the area. A very friendly receptionist initially welcomed me and gave me the registration documentation to fill in and bring back. The following afternoon I was met with a different receptionist who was rude and dismissive. Although I’m a British citizen, I’ve lived abroad and therefore speak with a foreign accent and so often receive the attitude that I don’t belong in the UK nor that I should be using the NHS.  I pay hefty taxes and NI contributions so I find this type of arrogant attitude really tiring and unprofessional, besides discriminating.

title: Fantastic Surgery!
body: Coltishall surgery is fantastic.  They are very easy to work with and always willing to try to help their patients with same day appointments, work ins, and clinician callbacks.  Its almost like they never say no.  They're easy to contact and are always positive.  I work for the NHS and hear opinions on other surgeries on a daily basis and Coltishall is the exception to what everyone complains about.  Great work guys!!!

title: Faultless experience
body:
I was admitted to St. Peters Hospital, Chertsey early January, 2020 to undergo an endoscopic ileocaecal resection.
The care and attention I received prior to, during and after my operation was second to none.  I cannot praise the whole team highly enough for the way I was treated and kept informed every step of the way.
I thank you

readBy.name: Ashford and St Peter's Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient good care/ service
body:
Following a telephone consultation I was seen by a doctor within 15 mins who took bloods immediately and by 6 pm that evening I had my diagnosis and medication. 
I would like express my gratitude to the whole team.
Thankyou.

title: Wonderful
body: I cannot rate the care I have received so far through Practitioner Health highly enough. My GP is so responsive and always there when I need her. This is such a valuable service for healthcare professionals. It is lifesaving.

title: Lovely staff
body: Had colonoscopy today at day surgery. What lovely staff .put me at ease and all were so friendly and had smiles on their faces .Good work!

title: Life saving treatment
body: I suffered a stroke whilst out shopping at the White Rose and thanks to the prompt attention of the para medics was speedily taken to the Leeds General Infirmary where the procedure to save my life was undertaken,  I was allowed to be discharged three days later thanks to the care I had experienced and am continuing to improve and getting back to a normal life. WE are very lucky to have a service which takes care of those who need it in a professional manner so thank you Yorkshire Ambulance Service.

title: Great practice
body:
Brilliant staff lovely doctors every thing is relaxed and not hurried 
Would definatly recomend and free parking

title: Absolutely fantastic prac5
body: I have been a patient at this practice for over 40 years! I have to say it is the best in the entire UK and i'm not exaggerating. The reception staff are truly amazing, very kind and caring and extremely efficient they will always go the extra mile with a smile regardless of what type of day they are having. The nurses are very caring and supportive and pleasant, as for the doctors there is not enough space here for me to write just how wonderful,  caring, efficient and professional they are. I feel truly blessed to be a patient here. I would like to thank you all for making my life easier in dealing with my many health issues.

title: GP review
body:
Seen by a new GP very through, and good assessment of my problem.very promote response to recent results and direct referral
Thanks

title: Human Touch
body: The team were excellent and friendly.  Made me calm and get me in the frame of mind to get on with my surgery.  Thank you

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: A Great day unit
body: I would highly recommend the access lounge day case unit to my family and friends. From start to finish I was treated with respect, dignity when I arrived in the unit. From the receptionist greeting me to the nurse doing my observations before my operation everyone was really friendly, helpful and courteous. The consultant and anaesthetic were really helpful explaining what would happen in my procedure which was a laparoscopic cholecystectomy and  made me feel at ease. After the operation the sister, nurses and other health workers looked after and observed me until I was able to go home later on. I just want to thank you you all for the care and treatment you all given to me this was much appreciated and you all deserve some recognition for all your generosity.

title: Great staff
body: I Arrived at after a fall at home and at first diagnosed with a severely fractured humerus whist there I was also diagnosed with Sleep Apnoea and further developed Type 2 respiratory failure I spent a few weeks in the Respiratory support unit on Brearley 4 the staff from the Doctors down to the Domestic were a great help in aiding my recovery and also stayed in another bay on the ward until I was well enough to released.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rapid and exceptional quality treatment
body: As a lifelong user of SRH I was dismayed to be taken to UHND by ambulance due to vicinity. I was met by my brother who had a car which was lucky as faced with 5.5hour wait in tiny full shabby reception, we left for SRH and was greeted with large spacious reception, pristeen state of the art unit, thorough nurse assessment and pain relief in 30mins, then nurse practitioner exam and escalation to registrar in less than an hour who conducted most thorough medical investigation I have ever had. She was only young and such a confident medic that if she represents the standard of ability and future of our doctors in the NHS then we should not only be be proud but also safe in the knowledge we are and always will be in very good hands. Every care professional was the highest level in competency, professionalism and interpersonal skills, I felt at ease throughout the journey despite my level of pain. I was left in no doubt from entering that changing hospitals was the best course of action and reaffirmed my lifelong policy, where it is within my power, I insist on only using SRH for my own and my family's acute or specialist medical needs. Outstanding!

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Impressive care
body:
From the first referral at the breast clinic to the final follow up, I have had superb care here. 
The consultant and all his staff treated me at all times  with such professionalism and efficiency, but also in a manner which was reassuring and friendly,so that my long standing anxiety and fear of hospitals has been hugely reduced. 
The consultant was careful to explain all the procedures and communicated perfectly throughout, so I felt fully involved. It The operating theatre and recovery staff were all lovely too, showing kindness and a sense of humour. I felt cared for and as if my experience was important, despite the department being particularly under pressure that day. 
Thank you to the wonderful consultant, surgery assistants and nurses for making my procedure as stress free as it could be.

author: bright ideas
title: Finally, real help..
body:
I have only praises of appreciation for the help and support I now receive,  
Here..? at Vanguard court.  
the on-site support is superb and I'm more confident then ever  
"I will succeed, and where I struggle, I know I have the support and fair treatment  
necessary and required to help get me out of my comfort zone and take on challenges  
where overwise, I felt i was doing it alone.

author: cornishpatient
title: Could not recommend them enough
body: It was arranged for me to have a half-knee replacement at Duchy Hospital. The staff could not have been more caring or helpful, I really felt as though my care was centered around me and that they did all they could to help me through. Although I was in hospital for longer than expected (3 more days), they catered for all my needs and provided me with regular pain relief, exploring all options available to minimise the pain I was in. They were very supportive during visiting time, allowing my family (though more than recommended number) to come in to visit me, showing them to my room and explaining everything to them about my operation and my progress. Could not recommend them enough and the consultant/ surgeon who carried out the procedure. 1 year on and I am more mobile and able to do things that were previously limited to me.

title: Outstanding!
body: I visited the Breast Unit today. I have to say, I was so impressed. All staff were friendly and knowledgeable, from reception to the Doctors completing the appointment. They were fast and efficient but were happy to give you time and care needed. Felt very relaxed. Had a couple of procedures and the whole thing worked like clockwork. Well done MK Hospital. Super impressed!!

readBy.name: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb treatment
body:
I was referred to St. Helens re suspicious moles. The appointment came through very quickly and when I attended was treated with courtesy and kindness.
On my second visit, for treatment, I was put at ease and every step of what was to happen was explained thoroughly .
The next appt., for results , I was kept calm, as these things can be scary, but everything was explained, and not rushed to be out of there. The consultant was lovely....eye contact, very important, didn't make me feel just like another case.
Treatment on going, so will report further!
So far so good.
Thank you to everyone at Dermatology ❤️💙❤️💙

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Compassionate staff
body:
I visited BPAS Richmond last week for a 2 day surgical abortion after making the extremely difficult decision when finding out about a late pregnancy. 
Having a phobia of needles I was extremely nervous. I was given a phone call consultation a week or so prior and they managed to fit me in but the dates were extremely limited and I am so grateful for them for managing to find an appointment for me. We booked a hotel as we live 2 hours from the clinic and I went on the first day. The wait times were long which didn’t help with anxiety but it’s understandable considering how busy the staff are. I was had the first part of the procedure done which was really hard for me and I could not thank the staff enough for being there for me and helping me through it. Not once did I feel judged, I was given so many options, and even when having the first part done they made me feel so comforted and listened to as I was extremely scared. The second morning I came back and had to wait but again I had no complaints about this it’s just to make people aware to be prepared for that. The second part was done under general anaesthetic so I do not remember but when I woke up I was in a lot of discomfort and the nurses were so caring they ensured I would not leave until I was as comfortable as can be. I just want to thank all of the staff that week at BPAS Richmond. That was one of the hardest things I’ve ever had to do and not something I ever thought I would have to decide at 21 but your compassion and care is what got me through it and I will forever be grateful for that.

title: Great nursing staff
body: The nurses where incredibly nice and efficient and they made my stay enjoyable even though I was I'll than you so much for the care and dedication

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Hospital
body: My whole experience with this hospital was outstanding.  I felt like a private patient from beginning to end, and even if I were, it would have exceeded my expectations.  I was able to pick a surgery time to suit my circumstances, the staff were so polite and welcoming, the facilities excellent and clean. The one thing I would like to say about any surgery is that we are all individual and my recovery time was longer than I anticipated and hoped.  Patience is the key so allow yourself plenty of time.  My life has been turned around following stabilisation of my lumbar spine.  If you've decided to have surgery then this is the hospital to come to.  Mrs A, Rutland

title: Fantastic doctors and staff
body: I (plus family) have been with this practice for over 25 years and have no hesitation in recommending them to anyone. The main doctors are first rate and perceptive, encouraging patients to talk even when they have difficulties. They are always keen to support patients and go above and beyond what you would generally expect.  The nurses and admin staff are also always keen to help and very responsive. An excellent practice.

title: A pleasant experience overall
body: Total knee replacement surgery carried out at the end of February 2020.All the staff I came into contact with were extremely professional and above all interested in me as an individual. The consultant put me at ease and as he was based at the hospital for the weekend I saw him three times and he checked how I was progressing.The facilities were first class and with regards to the food I have to say there was plenty of choice and was cooked to a high standard.I was asked by my own health authority to attend this hospital for my procedure and thankfully it was a great decision to do so. I am at some stage having my other knee replaced and will be enquiring as to whether I can return to the London Independent.Lastly I was admitted on a Friday and was back home Sunday afternoon.Overall a great experience.

title: Deeply disappointing
body:
Suffering as I do from severe depression as a registered disabled person, I made repeated phone calls to Health in Mind. Try as hard as I might I could not get an answer. I tried for the best part of a week. Eventually, someone answered the call. Finally, an appointment was made. 
When I arrived at Tekhnicon House in Braintree there was nowhere to park. 
After finally managing to park, and entered the building, which has no signs, to my complete dismay, the receptionist told me that my therapist was off ill. No-one had had the decency to notify me of this cancellation. I asked to speak to the service manager, and was told she was unavailable as she was said to be at lunch. Who takes lunch at 3.30 in the afternoon ? 
Based on my experience, Health in Mind, Mid-Essex IAPT are as much use to mental health patients as a chocolate fire guard. 
This service deserves to be taken over by Virgin Care. 
Thankfully I have private health insurance, but not everyone does of course. What happens to those patients who are failed by this service and have nowhere else to go ?
HPFT need to get their house in order. Health in Mid is not fit for purpose.

readBy.name: Hertfordshire Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Incredible
body:
The last time I wrote a letter was about six years ago. A long complaint letter about the poor treatment I had received on my stays in St Peters. I swore not to ever step foot in the place again, it was so horrendous, mainly about the attitude and lack of caring 
of staff.  
However, I feel very strongly I must write again. On Friday 14th Feb. I had to attend your  A & E department. I wasn’t looking forward to it but from the moment I walked into the A & E department I felt the difference. I anticipated abruptness and feeling a nuisance and what did I get? I haven’t stopped telling people since.
The whole process was so organised. Every person I came into contact with, whether it be doctors (2) medical staff or not, made me feel I mattered.  I came into contact with about 12 people in different roles. They were all caring and concerned for my comfort at every stage. Regardless of the fact that my process took 8 hours, the length of time due only to the wait between each different department I went to, I didn’t mind waiting. I felt at no time that I had been forgotten.  I had a thorough investigation to find out what was giving me so much pain and they finally got there leaving me very relieved and arrangements were made via my doctor for me to receive the necessary treatment I need. 
Two people went out of their way to help me, (even though it wasn’t their job!). One young lady from the pharmacy and the other one of the reception staff. 
What can I say? This should be a prime model of how to run an 
A & E department.  You deserve an award.
I do hope that your atmosphere and attitude has now spread to staff in other parts of the hospital. 
Best wishes for all the work you do and I know will continue to do.
Sincerely   Karen Steele  (age 84)

readBy.name: Ashford and St Peter's Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic
body: Spent 7 hours in A&E being tested. Fantastic staff and service. A big thank you to you all, you could not have been any kinder and more efficient.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good experience
body:
Mediscan, Ashton. 
Seen on time, no waiting around. The assistant was very polite and helpful. The sonographer was efficient and the Dr was polite and reassuring. Everything was explained to me, would not hesitate to use them again if need be.

title: Great support from Nurses and staff
body:
To the Nurses @ LRI who helped us out today with my Mrs who's broken her knee
You are all awesome
Thank you!!
From the moment we arrived they were polite, friendly, professional, and understanding
We could not ask for better service, the advice we were given was comprehensive and was explained.......Keep up the good work, and good luck with everything. You are our shining lights

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Fantastic attention
body: Lakeside/Forrestgate surgery are fantastic. When ever I attend any of them I am well looked after. Both surgery's are always very clean. The receptionists always very helpful. Our doctor is very attentive and always tries his very best to find out what our problems are and tries to make sure we get better or correct medication. I am always called with my test results when needed. Today I was surprised when my doctor called about my MRI scan, on a Sunday. This is because all the doctors,nurses office staff etc are working full out at moment to try and still look after all their patients even whilst this pandemic is raging. Thank you for all the help and attention we have received. Great practice

title: Very caring
body: I attended after having a bad fall and while I was waiting I felt faint.  A staff member wheeled me into a side room and between then and when I left I was treated with great care, nothing was too much bother for them, I had my BP, oxygen levels, and temperature taken then after having an x-ray on my battered knee I was patched up and sent on my way.

author: Quit smoking
title: Asked for help to stop smoking
body:
I waited 3 weeks to see a doctor to get help to quit smoking, I have been a smoker for 30 years and I made the decision to quit and needed help as quickly as possible so 3 weeks seemed along time to wait, when I saw the doctor who told me I had to attend the stop smoking clinic and that they would refer me over to them. I was very disappointed and thought that the doctor would give me the tablets that I needed to help me quit so my journey to quit would start from leaving the surgery so I thought, the doctor told me that it would take at least another 2 weeks for the smoking clinic to contact me with an appointment and get the tablets, my decision to quit now started to disappear.  
What's the point when you ask for help and get made to wait even longer, 2 weeks later I had a letter from the quit smoking clinic to call them and make an appointment I did this and attended only to be told by the health professional that they were really sorry that I had to wait and the doctors surgery should have given me the clinic number to call instead of waiting for the doctor, I had my health check with the clinic staff member and now I was informed that I had to take a letter back to my doctors to collect my prescription for the tablets 🙄  
So I handed them into reception as the pharmacy bit was not open this was on a Wednesday around 1pm the receptionist reassured me the tablets would be ready to collect by Friday afternoon, I was away for that weekend and said would it be ok to collect it on the Monday afternoon, I was told yes they will definitely be ready by then, so I thought great at last I can start my journey to quitting, how wrong was I.  
This is not the first time that wrong information has been given. I went to collect my tablets to be told that they didn't have them the letter I gave them on the Wednesday had been scanned into the computer but a doctor had not seen it yet and has to see it before they can do the prescription then they needed 2 days to order it in, I will not be using your dispensary it due to my experiences. I have for a long time now only ever collected the paper prescription and took it to my own chemist who can give me my medication on the same day.  
I feel the staff at this surgery have given out the wrong information in the past and when that happens its very unprofessional.

author: Alfysmum
title: Having my baby
body:
I had my baby last week following the ward change over to ward 15.  
I was nervous about the change but the staff were fantastic, they took it all in there stride and remained positive during such uncertain times. They kept a smile on all patients faces and made sure that the experience of bringing a child into the world was as magical as it should be.  
Every member of staff we dealt with from drs,midwives,maternity care assistants and students were all amazing and went above and beyond for us.  
So pleased with the experience.

author: snowwhite92
title: An amazing team
body:
Brought my 2 year old son into the minor injuries unit following a disaster with a baby gate. Was called into triage by a HCSW called Nicola who was absolutely amazing, paracetamol was given by nurse Lauren and it wasn’t an issue in the slightest!  
We were then called through to the minor injuries unit where my son was seen by Nurse Suzanne. What a lovely person, so calm and relaxed with my son. Spent so much time with him and he was more relaxed than me! At this time I appreciate the stress and difficulties all staff involved are facing. Well, the ones I met that day didn’t even show it. What an amazing team x

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Birth of my son
body: I developed pre eclampsia again as I done first time around. I was sent to Aberdeen Maternity Hospital as my local hospital has been downgraded. The care I received in Aberdeen was amazing! From the midwives, surgery staff, support workers they were all just incredible. I had a elective section after saying no to induction after my first experience with my first son and I will be forever grateful for the care I received

readBy.name: Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

author: waltzmh67
title: Spinal Injuries Unit
body: I was admitted to the unit in November 2019 and was discharged in March 2020. The care was fantastic, I felt supported and cared for. However, I think the units are in need of updating.

title: Great team
body: We have been a patient of this  surgery since we moved into the area. I can say we hold them in high respect. On many occasion have had to call on them and always got an appointment , phone call back and house call when appropiate. I dont abuse the system and treat all staff with respect. The doctors do a very good job as well as the nures. If you speak to them with respect you get respect back. Yes some time its difficult to get through on  the phone but thats not their fault when we all phone at 5he same time. Remember they are human. If it wasnt for them these last 5 years  my husband would be here. A greatful patient

title: 5 star treatment
body: I had to attend on 18th March to have my Gallbladder removed. Having never even had a general anaesthetic I was extremely nervous. The process was seamless and I was kept aware of every step I had to take. Within an hour I had seen the Surgeon and the anaesthetist and was prepped for surgery. They immediately sensed my nervousness and put me at ease. I didn’t cope well with the anaesthetic and was very sick for a few hours. The care and attention I received in the following few hours  whilst in recovery was outstanding and for which I am very grateful. If I have one criticism it was the lack of information on post op after care. I wasn’t really informed about changing dressings or when to see my Doctor etc. I would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hospital. I received 5 star treatment. Thank you

title: Very worrying practice
body: My daughter is currently on the post surgery ward. Last night, a nurse took a blood sample from the tube containing her TPN (liquid food) which is pumped directly into a tube which goes into a main artery, bypassing her bowel. Because the blood sample was diluted with the liquid in the tube, the results showed that she needed a blood transfusion. A doctor came in to see her first thing this morning asking if she had any idea why her blood count had dropped so much. My daughter explained that the nurse had used the feeding tube to take the blood. She told her not to use that tube because she knows it shouldn't be used for that purpose and  it can only be touched under extreme sterile conditions but the nurse over ruled her and said it would be fine.  Thank god my daughter is able to speak for herself otherwise she'd be having an unnecessary blood transfusion now.

title: Fantastic Care
body: I was taken in with a sports related back injury causing loss of leg use. All the staff I interacted with were at very worst, professional. At best they took the time to sit and explain the whats/whys/outcomes. My night nurse even took the time at 3 in the morning to sit with me and talk everything through after noticing I was a little bit shaken when she was taking my blood pressure. I can't overstate how much the fantastic treatment I received made this rubbish event that much easier. The surgery was a success and I've been given the best chance at making a good recovery. I will be forever grateful.

title: Leyland Physio
body: I had been experiencing tightness and pain in both shoulders for some months and thought it best to finally get checked out by a physio. After a lengthy Q&A session the physio instantly put my mind at ease advising this is something she has seen quite often and can be sorted. After just 3 sessions following massage and instructions about certain exercises I'd to perform at home, my pain was gone and my shoulder / arm movement was back to normal. I can't recommend my physio enough, totally professional, very knowledgeable and very friendly.

author: 2 box
title: Thank you NHS
body: I would just like to thank all NHS STAFF from top to the bottom for all the hard hard work you are doing through this terrible time I take my hat off to you all and say a big thank you and take care of yourself
